description:
From satellite image there is not much you can tell on this one. Could be good or not, unfortunately there is not so much.

Approach

It is possible to go up directly from Logs, through fields and forest. A unoficial path then leads to the other side of the river. At 1400m above sea level, go back to the water stream, there is a hunting path that goes there.

Descent

At first there is a high slab rappel, then some walking, and after crossing the path that got you up, there is a succession of smaller, more polished waterfalls. But at no point you'll feel in a real canyon.

Exit

The canyon ends close to the parked car, it is easy to get back

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Logsbach
